Uses of Class
org.ow2.bonita.facade.exception.MonitoringException

Packages that use MonitoringException
org.ow2.bonita.facade Contains interfaces for accessing Bonita APIs. 
org.ow2.bonita.facade.internal All interfaces in this package are for internal use only. 
 

Uses of MonitoringException in org.ow2.bonita.facade
 

Methods in org.ow2.bonita.facade that throw MonitoringException
 int BAMAPI.getAvailableProcessors()
          Returns the number of processors available to the Java virtual machine.
 long BAMAPI.getCurrentMemoryUsage()
          Get the sum of both heap and non-heap memory usage.
 String BAMAPI.getJvmName()
          Returns the Java virtual machine implementation name
 Map<String,String> BAMAPI.getJvmSystemProperties()
          Returns the Java virtual machine System properties list
 String BAMAPI.getJvmVendor()
          Returns the Java virtual machine implementation vendor
 String BAMAPI.getJvmVersion()
          Returns the Java virtual machine implementation version
 float BAMAPI.getMemoryUsagePercentage()
          Returns the percentage of memory used compare to maximum available memory.
 String BAMAPI.getOSArch()
          Returns the operating system architecture
 String BAMAPI.getOSName()
          Return the OS name
 String BAMAPI.getOSVersion()
          Return the OS version
 long BAMAPI.getStartTime()
          Returns a timestamp (in millisecond) which indicates the date when the Java virtual machine started.
 double BAMAPI.getSystemLoadAverage()
          Returns the system load average for the last minute.
 int BAMAPI.getThreadCount()
          Returns the current number of live threads including both daemon and non-daemon threads.
 long BAMAPI.getTotalThreadsCpuTime()
          Returns the total CPU time for all live threads in nanoseconds.
 long BAMAPI.getUpTime()
          Returns the number of milliseconds elapsed since the Java Virtual Machine started.
